API reference

add_label_column(df: DataFrame, label: int) → DataFrame[source]

Add a binary label column to the DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame.

  • label (int) – Label to assign to all rows (0 for real, 1 for fake).

Returns:

DataFrame with an added label column.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

basic_cleaning(df: DataFrame) → DataFrame[source]

Perform basic cleaning steps on the concatenated DataFrame.

Steps:

  1. Drop rows with any null values in critical columns (title, text).

  2. Combine title and text into a new column full_text.

Parameters:

df (pd.DataFrame) – Concatenated DataFrame containing both real and fake news.

Returns:

Cleaned DataFrame with a new full_text column.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

load_raw_data(true_path: Path, fake_path: Path) → Tuple[DataFrame, DataFrame][source]

Load the raw True and Fake news datasets.

Parameters:

  • true_path (Path) – Path to True.csv file.

  • fake_path (Path) – Path to Fake.csv file.

Returns:

DataFrames for authentic (True) and fake news articles, respectively.

Return type:

Tuple[pd.DataFrame, pd.DataFrame]

save_processed_data(df: DataFrame, output_path: Path) → None[source]

Save the processed DataFrame to disk as a Parquet file.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – Processed DataFrame.

  • output_path (Path) – Destination path for the output file. The parent directory will be created if it doesn’t exist.

Run all EDA analyses and save outputs.

preprocess_dataset(df: DataFrame, text_col: str = 'full_text') → DataFrame[source]

Apply preprocess_text to a DataFrame column.

Adds a new column clean_text.

preprocess_text(text: str) → str[source]

Clean, tokenize, remove stopwords and lemmatize a single document.

Steps:

  1. Lower-case.

  2. Remove punctuation, digits & special characters.

  3. Collapse multiple whitespaces.

  4. Remove stop-words.

  5. Lemmatize each remaining token.

Parameters:

text (str) – Raw input text.

Returns:

A space-separated string of processed tokens.

Return type:

str

run_cli(processed_path: Path, output_path: Path | None = None) → None[source]

Command-line entry: read parquet, preprocess, write parquet.

vectorize_and_split(clean_path: Path, output_dir: Path, max_features: int = 50000, ngram_range: Tuple[int, int] = (1, 2), test_size: float = 0.2, random_state: int = 42)[source]

Vectorise clean text using TF-IDF and split into train/test sets.

Saves:

  • vectorizer.joblib – fitted TfidfVectorizer

  • X_train.npz / X_test.npz – sparse TF-IDF matrices

  • y_train.npy / y_test.npy – label arrays
